channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Powell blasts DOJ criminal probe as attack on Fed independence. ‘Public service sometimes requires standing firm in the face of threats’
item.description: He said in a statement Sunday that the Justice Department served the Fed with grand jury subpoenas, threatening a criminal indictment.

item.title: How Olympians Think About Success and Failure and What We Can Learn From Them
item.description: ‘Most of the athletes who come through Team USA will not win a gold medal.’

item.title: Buddhist monks are walking barefoot from Texas to D.C. with their dog, drawing big crowds across the South
item.description: Beyond promoting peace, their highest priority is connecting with people along the way.

item.title: What global executives need to ask about China in 2026
item.description: China presents new challenges—particularly from confident local competitors—but the country still presents offers for disciplined executives.

item.title: A $400,000 Payout After Maduro’s Capture is Putting Prediction Markets in the Spotlight

item.title: Doctors Say Changes to U.S. Vaccine Recommendations Are Confusing Parents and Could Harm Kids
item.description: Vaccines for hepatitis A, hepatitis B and meningococcal diseases are no longer universally recommended.

item.title: IRS Announces Little-Known Trick to Get Your 2026 Tax Returns Accepted Early
item.description: Can’t wait to file for a refund? Qualified taxpayers can start today, says the Internal Revenue Service. Using Free File can help.
